body.p: Interneurons of the spinal cord function to transmit impulses between neurons in CNS. Some spinal reflexes will involve sensory input from one side of body and motor output to the other side of body.
The interneurons involved in this pathway would be most likely found in what spinal cord structure visible in the cross sectional view?

response.feedback: Incorrect. While this is gray matter, it contains somatic motor neurons with which the interneurons may synapse.
Incorrect. This is a space between white matter of columns.

Correct. This is the gray matter area connecting right and left horns; in this example the interneuron would connect a sensory neuron from posterior horn on one side to motor neuron in anterior horn on other side of spinal cord.
Incorrect. This is white matter connecting right and left columns.
Incorrect. This is white matter area containing ascending and descending tracts.
